name: places/ChIJzZUgRgT2wokRK87fW1CK95g
formattedAddress: 181 E 111th St, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 181 E 111th St, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text:
Instinct has been truly amazing for my pup Hendricks and me!

For background, Hendricks is a 1 year old rescue. When I first adopted him in August 2023, he was high energy, very reactive towards other dogs, sensitive to loud noises and would react with very loud barks, and just in general had a hard time settling down. I researched a lot online and started training him on my own, but decided it would be beneficial to seek professional help, specifically from those that used positive training and would train him in NYC.

I started with 3 at-home classes with Mari, who really helped teach me the basics and prioritize what to work on with Hendricks. Then, I signed him up for two camps that coincided with my travel plans over Thanksgiving and Christmas. He stayed at the East Harlem facility for 2 weeks in November, then was back with me for a couple weeks, then back at Instinct for 3 weeks across Dec-Jan. There, he worked directly with Oyuki to help learn settling skills, loose leash walking, navigating around other dogs and dealing with his reactivity, and more (Recall, Drop, etc.)

While he was at camp, Oyuki and the canine care team all sent frequent updates, along with pictures and videos to show me how he was doing and what he was learning. He clearly had a blast there and loved playing in the big backyard and running around with other pups who were specifically selected to match with his needs. From a training perspective, Oyuki was very responsive to my many questions and very helpfully showed and taught me what I would need to do. The videos were also especially helpful for me to see how to continue to train Hendricks, once he transitioned back home to my care. The camp also came with a mid-camp in-facility lesson, as well as ones at the end when I came to take Hendricks home, and it was great to be able to talk with Oyuki and see in person how she handled certain situations with Hendricks. It was also so sweet to see the bond that they built up with each other!

Hendricks absolutely fell in love with Oyuki, and he’s learned so much from her! He’s calmed down significantly and can now settle on his own comfortably without me having to guide him. His reactivity has also improved tremendously, and he can now mostly walk neutrally by other dogs. Of course, he’ll always stay a reactive dog, but he’s learning to deal with it, and I have much better control over it as well. He’s better with impulse control, and can take time to think and listen before he acts. His basic cues are also much improved and more consistent. And personally for me, I feel like a better, smarter dog owner and much more confident in my own ability to train him too.

All in all, I cannot recommend Instinct enough. From the start with in-home lessons to his camps to all the follow-up afterwards, it’s so clear that each and every one of Instinct’s team members care so much for Hendricks and also do their best to help me learn as much as I can. Thank you so much to everyone at Instinct for all that you do - Hendricks and I are forever grateful!!!

originalText.text: Jessica changed our lives! We came to instinct because of Winnie’s major fear reactivity and overall anxiety about the world. When we started we could barely go outside without Winnie reacting to something and it being really stressful for both of us. Jessica gave us both tools and confidence to move through the world together. 2 years later and Winnie is doing things I never thought imaginable for her. Going on hikes, taking vacations, running on the beach, happily meeting new people and dogs! Of course it’s still something we work hard for everyday, but we do it with confidence! We will always be grateful to Jessica and instinct! And highly recommend anyone to use them no matter the circumstances you and your dogs are facing, they will help you with kindness and compassion ❤️

And highly recommend anyone to use them no matter the circumstances you and your dogs are facing, they will help you with kindness and compassion ❤️

originalText.text:
We had an amazing experience here with Instinct. We opted to go with a 5 week at home puppy training with Mari, and it was perfect. Mari is kind, caring, patient and extremely knowledgeable, and has not only helped our new puppy acclimate to NYC, but also taught my girlfriend and I so much about our puppy and dog training/behavior as well. We are especially grateful as we found out after purchasing our puppy that he was from a puppy mill, and we were so nervous about what his experience would be like, and Mari and the folks at instinct helped us every step of the way and I would not change a single thing about my puppy or decision because of it.

We also attended the free puppy classes on Sundays with Rebecca, and she is awesome as well.

From my first phone conversation with Jessica, to the free in person visit to meet my puppy, to the home training and boarding, everything we have done with instinct has been phenomenal.

These folks really love dogs, and I highly recommend them!

originalText.text:
We are so glad we called Instinct! We had a bad experience with a previous trainer, but the second Ayelet got on the phone with us we knew we were in good hands. We were even sent an hour long questionnaire about our dog's history/health/behavior/etc. prior to training. Y'all...they care so much!

We have a 1 year old rescue pup who's dog reactive, and we've been pretty much unable to take him on walks or near other dogs at all. Jenna helped us overcome all of this and we could not be more grateful. She coached us on how to slowly warm him up to lots of different scenarios- we even had a playdate with another dog today with no issues! His reactivity will be something we'll continue to work on for months, but I can't tell you how relieved we are to have gained some confidence with it. Jenna really helped put things into perspective and helped us understand how to read our dog and take things at his pace. You really can't rush progress like this, and I love that Instinct doesn't promise "quick, fast, easy results" because those are not effective or even possible.

We would absolutely do this again if given the chance, booking with Instinct was a game changer.

originalText.text: This is a review for Instinct's Board and Camp program in Harlem, NY. I sent my dog Dash to camp for 2 weeks to work on leash training skills and reinforce some commands for better behavior. I worked very closely with Rebecca who was super thorough in her communication and follow-ups. After camp, Rebecca visited us at home twice to help me implement the things both Dash and I learned in our regular environment. This was critical for both of us. Dash absolutely loved her and all of the trainers he interacted with at Instinct. We both gained a lot of confidence for our walks together and I went from being pulled down the street to walking with him beside me on a slack leash - pretty amazing. Can't say enough good things about how organized and helpful the staff at Instinct have been. Highly recommend.
